safety-tips.title: Check Your Privacy Settings
safety-tips.text: Most social media and online platforms have privacy settings that control who can see your posts, contact you, or find your profile. Regularly review these settings and keep your profiles private. Only accept friend or follow requests from people you actually know. Be aware that even with privacy settings, anything you post online can potentially be shared or screenshotted.

quiz.question: What are privacy settings?
options: A way to ensure YOU choose who can see your posts, contact you, or find your profile.
A way to emphasize we want privacy at this time.
A way to create a private chat with someone so no one can see our conversation.
quiz.correctAnswer: A way to ensure YOU choose who can see your posts, contact you, or find your profile.

safety-tips.title: Spotting Phishing Scams
safety-tips.text: Phishing is when hackers send fake emails or texts to trick you into giving away your password. They often pretend to be a trusted brand like Instagram, Netflix, or your bank. To stay safe, always check the sender's actual email address. Hackers might use 'support@instagraam-security.com' instead of the real '@instagram.com'. Most importantly: Never click a link to 'verify your account' or 'update your payment' directly from an email. Always go to the official website by typing the address yourself into your browser.

quiz.question: What is the safest way to visit a website if you receive an urgent security email?
options: Click the link provided in the email
Reply to the email asking if it's real
Type the official website address directly into your browser
Download the attachment to see more details
quiz.correctAnswer: Type the official website address directly into your browser

phishing.title: How to handle suspicious delivery/payment messages
steps: Don’t click links or pay fees directly from messages.
Verify through the official app/website by typing the address yourself.
Look for red flags: urgency, shortened links, unexpected payments.
Report the message as phishing and delete it.
whyThisWorks: Scammers use urgency to make you act without thinking.
Short links can hide malicious websites.
Independent verification explains whether the message is real.

scam.title: How to handle verification-code and account takeover scams
steps: Never share verification/login codes with anyone — ever.
Verify the request by calling your friend using a number you already have.
If they pressure you, assume the account is compromised.
Report the suspicious account and warn the real person via another channel.
whyThisWorks: Those codes are basically the key to YOUR account.
Impersonators rely on urgency and guilt to bypass your judgment.
Verifying via a trusted channel breaks the scam.

harassment.title: How to handle harassment and toxic group chats
steps: Don’t participate or amplify harassment, even as a joke.
Support the targeted person privately if you can.
Use platform tools: report, block, mute, and leave if needed.
whyThisWorks: Harassment escalates when it gets attention.
Support from bystanders reduces harm to the target.
Reporting creates accountability without escalating conflict.

nodes.message: Your package is held. Pay ₪8.90: bit.ly/3XxYz
Payment failed. Enter card details again to release package.

good_end.summary: You avoided a suspicious link and verified through an official channel.

bad_end.summary: You shared sensitive information through an untrusted link.

nodes.message: Hey! I'm locked out of my account. I put your number as a backup. You're gonna get a 6-digit code, can you send it to me real quick?

options.text: Send the code once it arrives
Ask them a personal question only they would know
Call your friend on their actual phone

nodes.message: I don't have time for games, just send it or I'll lose my account forever!

good_end.summary: You recognized the 'Verification Code' scam. Never share codes with anyone.

bad_end.summary: The code was for YOUR account. By sharing it, the hacker can now take over your profile.

nodes.message: Someone in the group chat is posting embarrassing, edited photos of another student and tagging them.

options.text: Join in with a joke to fit in
Take screenshots and report to the platform
Tell the bully to stop in the main chat

nodes.message: The bully starts attacking you now, calling you names for 'ruining the fun'.

options.text: Mute, Block, and Leave the chat

good_end.summary: Reporting and disengaging is the best way to handle toxicity without escalating.

bad_end.summary: Participating in harassment makes the environment worse and can have consequences for you too.
